issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Delete on Terminate specified at run-time doesn't override image default

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Appears delete on terminate false is always reported as true in eee 2517. End goal of this test was to set deleteOnTerminate=False in order to leave a volume around to create a snapshot after the instance has terminated. Not sure if this is cosmetic on the "describe" and/or if this is a dup or related to rt#5652, opening this bug to track in the case it is not. Thanks, -M Summary of debug shown below: ----RUN----- [root@eucahost-51-82 ~]#euca-run-instances emi-30E944AC --debug --block- device-mapping /dev/sda1=snap-C36D40FE::false -g test -k testkey -n 1 -t m1.small (BlockDeviceMapping.1.Ebs.DeleteOnTermination=false) ---DESCRIBE----- [root@eucahost-51-82 ~]#euca-describe-instances --debug i-59D042E0 (true) -------------commands with debug--------------------------- euca-run-instances emi-30E944AC --debug --block-device-mapping /dev/sda1=snap- C36D40FE::false -g test -k testkey -n 1 -t m1.small 2012-01-13 09:25:59,635 euca2ools [DEBUG]:Method: POST 2012-01-13 09:25:59,635 euca2ools [DEBUG]:Path: /services/Eucalyptus/ 2012-01-13 09:25:59,636 euca2ools [DEBUG]:Data: 2012-01-13 09:25:59,636 euca2ools [DEBUG]:Headers: {} 2012-01-13 09:25:59,636 euca2ools [DEBUG]:Host: 192.168.51.82:8773 2012-01-13 09:25:59,636 euca2ools [DEBUG]:establishing HTTP connection: kwargs={} 2012-01-13 09:25:59,637 euca2ools [DEBUG]:using _calc_signature_2 2012-01-13 09:25:59,638 euca2ools [DEBUG]:query string: AWSAccessKeyId=I1XIJNC LGPC8T7GF1MPYZ&Action=RunInstances&BlockDeviceMapping.1.DeviceName=%2Fdev%2Fsd a1&BlockDeviceMapping.1.Ebs.DeleteOnTermination=false&BlockDeviceMapping.1.Ebs .SnapshotId=snap-C36D40FE&ImageId=emi-30E944AC&InstanceType=m1.small&KeyName=t estkey&MaxCount=1&MinCount=1&SecurityGroup.1=test&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&S ignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2012-01-13T17%3A25%3A59Z&Version=2009-11-30 2012-01-13 09:25:59,639 euca2ools [DEBUG]:string_to_sign: POST 192.168.51.82:8773 /services/Eucalyptus/ AWSAccessKeyId=I1XIJNCLGPC8T7GF1MPYZ&Action=RunInstances&BlockDeviceMapping.1. comments.body: Originally posted on 2012-01-13 17:38:15 by matt.clark@eucalyptus.com Fri Jan 13 09:38:14 2012: Request 5667 was acted upon. Transaction: Ticket created by matt.clark Queue: Engineering Bugs Subject: delete on terminate false is always reported as true Owner: Nobody Requestors: matt.clark@eucalyptus.com Status: new Ticket Appears delete on terminate false is always reported as true in eee 2517. End goal of this test was to set deleteOnTerminate=False in order to leave a volume around to create a snapshot after the instance has terminated. Not sure if this is cosmetic on the "describe" and/or if this is a dup or related to rt#5652, opening this bug to track in the case it is not. Thanks, -M Summary of debug shown below: ----RUN----- [root@eucahost-51-82 ~]#euca-run-instances emi-30E944AC --debug --block-device-mapping /dev/sda1=snap-C36D40FE::false -g test -k testkey -n 1 -t Suggested fix has been unit tested and is currently pending code review. Final fix will be reviewed for post 3.1 integration to the master branch.

Verified proper return values from describe-instances when setting deleteonterminate to false and true using:
euca-run-instances emi-09BF3CF4 -b /dev/sda1=::false
euca-run-instances emi-09BF3CF4 -b /dev/sda1=::true

Also attempted a run with:
euca-run-instances emi-09BF3CF4 -b /dev/sda1=:3:false

in order to change the root volume size at runtime and was also successful.
This was marked for 3.1.1 but looks like it didn't make it, since the behaviour still exists.  Can we get this into 3.1.2 ?

Hey Ken, to immediately answer a couple of those:

0)  Packages from the official repo
3)  3.1.1 from pkgs, on RHEL6.2.  Euca2ools is at 2.1.1 (euca2ools-2.1.1-0.32.el6.noarch
euca2ools-release-2.1-2.el6.noarch)

To partially answer (1), these steps:

1. 

{code}euca-run-instances emi-6EBD3D78 -b /dev/vda1=::false -k admin -g default -n 1 -t m1.xlarge{code}

2. 

{code}euca-describe-volumes
VOLUME  vol-CF713DE4     20     snap-C35240BB   cluster01       in-use  2012-09-11T12:10:54.383Z{code}

3.  

{code}euca-terminate-instances i-91F33A5E{code}

4.  

{code}euca-describe-volumes
VOLUME  vol-CF713DE4     20     snap-C35240BB   cluster01       in-use  2012-09-11T12:10:54.383Z{code}

5.  

{code}euca-describe-instances 
i-91F33A5E      emi-6EBD3D78    172.23.231.92   172.23.231.92   terminated      admin   0               m1.xlarge       2012-09-11T12:10:54.305Z     cluster01                               monitoring-disabled     172.23.231.92   172.23.231.92                   ebs{code}

6. 

{code}euca-describe-volumes
VOLUME  vol-CF713DE4     20     snap-C35240BB   cluster01       deleted 2012-09-11T12:10:54.383Z{code}
